paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a BRCA2 variant, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: no mutations at 67 of the 68 sites; heterozygous mutation at one site

individual_records.phenotype_details: heterozygous mutation at one site in BRCA2
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Caucasian female had no mutations at 67 of the 68 sites, but she has a heterozygous mutation at one site in BRCA2.

functional_data.summary: The mutation causes a single amino acid change.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was originally reported to carry a 30-40% increased risk of breast cancer, although a subsequent study reported no increased cancer risk.
key_quotes: This A-C mutation causes a single amino acid change, N372 H, in exon 10, which in homozygous form was originally reported to carry a 30-40% increased risk of breast cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was straightforward as only one BRCA2 variant was reported.
